message.content:
cs.SY, cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the problem of attacking and authenticating cyber-physical systems, which involves the intersection of several CS sub-fields such as systems and control (cs.SY), cryptography and security (cs.CR), information theory (cs.IT), machine learning (cs.LG), and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The focus on a scalar, discrete-time, time-invariant, linear plant and the use of statistical and information-theoretic tools suggest cs.SY and cs.IT as the most likely categories. However, the consideration of learning-based attacks and the use of machine learning algorithms point towards cs.LG and cs.AI as relevant sub-fields as well. Finally, the emphasis on authentication and watermark-based methods aligns with the scope of cs.CR.
